results.title: Buckstop
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Rhian Hinkley
results.brief_description: Five minutes of animation through the use of 3,000 still photographs serves as a homage to the spaghetti Western, as Buck rides into town looking for a bit of action and a parking space.

results.title: Bucklesbury farm
results.creator_credit: Eileen Molony, BBC-TV and George Inger
results.brief_description: This film shows a Britsol school six weeks after the beginning of term. An experienced teacher, new to the school, is shown introducing practical science and mathematics along lines recommended by Science 5/13: a project jointly sponsored by the Schools Council and the Nuffield Foundation. Suitable for Tertiary level students.

results.title: Buck Rogers. Vol. 5
results.creator_credit: David J. O'Connell, Jock Gaynor, Phil Leacock, Dick Lowry and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Buck Rogers in the 25th century”.
In ‘Unchained woman’, The Earth Defense Directorate send Buck and Wilma on a mission to rescue Jen Burton, the partner of notorious shipping pirate Malary Pantera, from a state-of-the-art underground jail where she has been incarcerated for a murder that Pantera actually committed. Masquerading as a convict, Buck infiltrates the high-tech facility, detonates a bomb, and they break out, heading to a nearby spaceport to meet Wilma and return to Earth. However, an android prison guard damaged during the explosion begins a relentless pursuit of them, determined to uphold the law. Their situation is complicated further when a traitorous ambassador informs Malary of Jen’s escape and the Earth Directorate’s plans to use her to gain information that will ultimately lead to his arrest. It is up to Buck and Wilma to both defeat him and shut down the obsessed android before Jen is silenced forever. In ‘Planet of the Amazon women’, Buck is lured to the planet Zantia after answering a distress call from two women whose space yacht is malfunctioning. Once on the planet’s surface, he learns that there is a shortage of men on Zantia, and that he is to be sold off to the highest bidder at an auction. Purchased by the Prime Minister’s daughter Ariela, he is surprised when he discovers what her true intentions are. With Wilma leaving delicate trade negotiations to go in search of her missing friend, it is up to Buck and Ariela to overthrow her mother’s oppressive government and liberate the planet’s male population from their captors before they declare another war on Zantia. Stars Gil Gerard as Buck, Erin Gray as Col. Deering, and Tim O’Connor as Dr. Huer. Special guest Jamie Lee Curtis stars as Jen Burton in ‘Unchained woman’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David J. O’Connell, Jock Gaynor, Phil Leacock, Dick Lowry and Universal Pictures

results.title: Bubu Films
results.brief_description: An experimental film with an imaginative use of sound. Conveys the impression of a vast shadowy world of offices and vague ghostly people who provide the forms which require your signature. Kafka-esque, impressionistic and likely to puzzle most audiences.

results.title: Bubbling over
results.brief_description: Short comedy film with singer Ethel Waters playing the part of a wife whose husband’s lazy live-in relatives make life difficult. Featuring Hamtree Harrington, the Southernaires Quartet, William Edmondson and Frank L. Wilson.

results.title: Bubbles Co-op: secondary fiction (Episode 3)
results.brief_description: This films presents two fiction films from the University of Melbourne “Bubbles Co-op” Film Festival. ine is in black and white and is technically poor; the second is shorter in length and is in colour. Suitable for Upper Primary-Upper Secondary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Bubbles Co-op: secondary animation (Episode 1)
results.brief_description: This film presents secondary school students’ animated films which were screened at the University of Melbourne “Bubbles Co-op” Film Festival. Indicates the range and depth of their concerns, imagination and considerable talents. A stimulating, amusing and refreshing compilation. Suitable for Upper Primary-Upper Secondary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Bubbles Co-op. Part 1: primary films
results.brief_description: A compilation of primary school children’s films which were screened at Melbourne University “Bubbles Co-op” Film Festival. Films shown include a science fiction drama, a social documentary and several animated films. Suitable for Upper Primary-Upper Secondary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Bsss
results.brief_description: A fly meets an elephant…by the book! A fly buzzes around a room landing upon a book with pictures of an elephant inside. The fly appears to investigate the drawing. A human squashes the fly into the book. Fly and elephant are united. (Screened at MISAF, October 2000.)
